intro: Onychium japonicum var. intermedium, commonly known as the Japanese onychium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant features upright, branched stems covered in soft, hairy foliage. Its flowers are small, clustered in dense inflorescences, typically appearing in shades of pink or white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats.
